intro: Cacalia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are broad and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow centers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets.
